oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Johnny Lee Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Johnny Lee (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Johnny Lee; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Johnny Lee reveals his original name was Johnny Lee Ham and that his father had left his family -- (01:22) Lee reflects on the directions to Alta Loma, Texas and Lee discusses living on his whole family living on a single road -- (02:33) Biff Collie has Lee remember the difficulties of working on a dairy farm and Lee reflects on cleaning cows -- (03:50) Lee discusses being around his cousins and how they would get him in trouble -- (04:37) Lee reflects on his desire to be a singer, but Lee was always worried to tell anyone -- (05:50) Lee tells Collie about his desire to be a singer and how he did not initially decide to be a singer, but a police officer, after his military service -- (07:33) Lee reflects on the time he had been a car racer and his time in construction -- (08:28) Lee discusses how his grandfather had influenced his desire to create something lasting -- (08:54) Lee's high school baseball career is discussed -- (10:13) Lee reflects on how he learned to play the guitar after his cousin had been given a guitar -- (10:56) Lee reflects on how his step-father refused to allow Lee to play sports -- (11:50) Lee remembers using his trumpet and playing in high school -- (12:57) Lee remembers attempting to play high school football, but Lee's band teacher did not allow it -- (14:16) Lee recalls breaking his leg working on the dairy farm -- (14:46) Collie and Lee reflect on Lee's time with Johnny Lee and the Roadrunners -- (15:40) Lee tells about his roadrunner tattoo -- (15:57) Lee discusses how he worked in the boiler room while being in the military and how he requested a transfer -- (18:37) Lee reflects on how he had engaged Vietnamese water crafts -- (19:20) Collie has Lee reflect on why he moved back to Texas -- (19:52) Lee recalls forming a band and working at Cedar Oaks -- (21:05) Collie reads a quote to Lee, and Lee recalls having his grandfather with him when Lee went through negotiations -- (22:44) Lee recalls the first time he heard himself on the radio -- (23:37) Collie and Lee discuss Lee going up to Mickey Gilley and Gilley having Lee perform at his club -- (26:10) Lee tells about how he had misled Gilley -- (26:36) Lee reflects on how he was the vocalist, drummer, and trumpeter for Gilley -- (28:12) Collie and Lee reflect on how John Travolta met with Lee and Gilley -- (29:28) Collie has Lee recall how there was notions of an upcoming movie while Lee worked at Gilley's -- (29:58) Lee asserts that he was asked to perform on a movie after being heard in Gilley's -- (31:02) Lee attests the nature of personalities, that come into Gilley's, as dishonest -- (31:30) Collie and Lee discuss how Gilley's had grown exponentially -- (32:11) Lee discusses the television show he started with Gilley, named Gilley's, sponsored by Utah Carl -- (33:29) Lee discusses how Aaron Latham came to Texas to observe the country lifestyle -- (34:11) Lee tells about how Urban Cowboy got its script -- (35:32) Lee reflects on his ability to go on the road -- (35:57) Lee recalls how his popularity was starting to increase, and how Gilley convinced Lee to put his money into the bank -- (38:26) Lee recalls meeting Charlene Tilton at the 20 Year Bandstand Special -- (39:38) Lee describes courting Tilton and his comfortability with popularity -- (40:48) Lee and Collie discuss a tabloid article about him abusing a dog -- (44:46) Lee recalls being in the Dallas Fort Worth Airport when he met a beautiful women (Lee's eventual wife) -- (48:06) Lee tells of a time he used a orangutan to mess with Gilley on stage -- (50:21) Lee reflects on his bus driver usually getting the band lost -- (53:08) Lee reflects on his new opportunity to record while expressing his displeasure with a previous member of management -- (55:05) Lee discusses how he pays out his expenses -- (55:19) Lee discusses his son's name Johnny Lee the 2nd -- (56:07) Lee expresses his idea of what lies ahead for himself
